result.execSummary:
The defendant Henry Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Henry Williams

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Henry Williams in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Henry Williams in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
As to Counts 1 and 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
As to Count 1:  Defendant ordered to serve 6 months in the House of Correction concurrent to Count 2, with credit of 66 days time served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation with the Mental Health Unit for 18 months with the following conditions:

As to Count 2:  Defendant ordered to serve 6 months in the House of Correction concurrent to Count 1, with credit of 66 days time served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation with the Mental Health Unit for 18 months with the following conditions:

*No new violations that rise to the level of probable cause.
*Condition time of two 10 day sanction periods to be used at the agent's discretion.
*Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges during period of probation, as to count 1.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
*Court waives all mandatory costs and surcharges as to Count 2 due to defendant's low income.

Filed: Pretrial Incarceration Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Henry Williams not in court, in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 46. Defense requests this case be held on the same date as the previously scheduled case. jks  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 04-16-2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.   Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Pick N Save located at 6760 W. National Ave, West Allis, Wisconsin or Harbor Freight located at 6808 W. Greenfield Ave., West Allis, Wisconsin.

Defendant Henry Williams in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Defendant Henry Williams in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Henry Williams
Current: 5701 W. Auer Ave., Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 02-12-2015)
Prior: 6801 West Burleigh Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210

Defendant Henry Williams not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Initial appearance scheduled for this date 3-9-2015. Defendant is in custody at. Both files sent to in custody court.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 3/9/15 @ 1:30 pm
